name: Occidental Grand Aruba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just arrived back from the Occidental Grand Aruba 1/10/08 and have to say its the best holiday ive had. Having stayed at Iberostars twice in Dom rep and once in Mexico which were fabulous too, we thought it was time to try something else.
reviews.title: Loved every minute!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aruba is a lovely island full of the most friendly people you could wish to meet, there are lots of places to go and loads of designer shops and yummy restaurants.
reviews.title: Maybe 5 star facility, but not 5 star service
Great Honeymoon
reviews.text: We stayed at the Occidental which may not look as grand as the Riu Palace but believe me its better by far. The rooms are gorgeous with dvd player, coffee maker, iron and mini bar. There are 4 a la carte restaurants which are all good, but the italian is by far the best, the service and the food was amazing and the fillet steak is to die for! We only used the buffet on a couple of evenings as we used a la carte restaurants twice each and also there is a beach party every thursday night which is great too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During the day we used the pool bar for breakfast and lunch and we found the food delicous especially the chili, nachos and burgers. All drink seemed to be premium brands even on the beach which is very unusual, my only moan is there is no cocktail list in the whole place which is a bit odd. So you have to ask what people are drinking to find out what each one is.
reviews.title: ruined my honeymoon
Our Amazing Vacation in Aruba (planned by Pericas Rotary Travel)
reviews.text: We hired a jeep for the day which was hysterical at times but try not to hire one from amigos as ours was a bucket of bolts! We went from one end of aruba to the other and spent a few hours swimming at baby beach which was lovely. We also went to De Palm Island for the day and it was beautiful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our second visit to this hotel - we just love aruba - although were disappointed to see so much development going on in and around the area - please don.t spoil our favourite spot.
reviews.title: return visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel continues to be good value for money, although not as sparkling as first visit.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.liked: — The bed was very comfortable, and the air conditioner was really cold.
likes.disliked: — The rooms next to the lobby and the nightly shows.

reviews.text: There were a lot of noisy groups along our corridor who had no respect for other guests!
reviews.title: Omar

likes.disliked: — non responsive mangement ( not the servers)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just love the beach, the pool area is crowded, and have to admit that weddings in paradise tend to encourage large partys all trying to get sunbeds together and take over areas of the hotel.
reviews.title: What a let down!

likes.disliked: — NO POWER!! Restaurant shut down, food was cold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was average at the buffet but can book visits to the specialist restaurants.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Occidental from October 5th through the 12th for our honeymoon. Overall, I'd rate it as a very positive experience. Check-in was quick and painless. From there, you have to go to guest services to book your dinner reservations for the length of your stay. For a 7 night stay, you only get to book 4 in advance, which we booked one at every restaurant. We had to change a couple of them around, but while others had trouble with that part, it was pretty easy for us. The only time we had a problem was one night we had a 6:00 reservation for the Oriental Restaurant and we got back from our Jeep tour at 6:30, so we missed our reservation and were unable to eat Hibachi style later in the evening, but the restaurant worked us in with no hassle, we just had to sit at a regular table.
reviews.title: Mostly good with a few negative marks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've read many reviews, and I can't believe that no one has mentioned the number of people who work for the "Occidental Vacation Club." They are trying to sell timeshares, and they bombard you everywhere you go. They tell you that if you sit through a 60-minute presentation you can have your choice of a free gift...there are many options there, but we went with the Jeep tour. The presentation turned out to be about 90 minutes, but still, there was the free gift. Everywhere you go, though, there are people trying to get you into the vacation club for their presentation. Beware the employees in the blue shirts...most of them say "Vision Security" on the shirt, but they are hardly security personnel.
reviews.title: Good Vacation - SoSo Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was overall good. We were most looking forward to the Italian restaurant with their "selection of wines from around the world" but were most disappointed in that. All of the restaurants offer a merlot, a cabernet, and a chardonnay. That's it. The Mexican restaurant has Corona, but other than that, the only beer you can get is the local beer, Balashi or Balashi light.
reviews.title: Awesome!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was comfortable. We had no trouble getting our room cleaned or keeping our towels stocked. The mini-fridge gets restocked every other day. They provide you with 2 cans of coke, 2 diet cokes, 2 sprites, 4 baby bottles of water, and 2 baby cans of beer. The balcony was pretty small, but had a great view of the ocean and beach from the 5th floor where our room was.
reviews.title: Just Excellent !!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We upgraded to the grand romance package since we were on our honeymoon. That was supposed to include an in-room couple's massage, a bottle of champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, a romantic dinner, a surprise gift, a 10% spa discount voucher, and a few other things. There is no in-room couple's massage option. You have to go to either a place in the lobby or a place on the beach...we chose the beach location and enjoyed it so much that we used our 10% spa voucher and got another massage later in the week. We didn't get our chocolate covered strawberries upon arrival, so I asked the next morning about that, and they were delivered to our room that night, but not until around 10:30 pm!! The "surprise gift" is a T-shirt. The romantic dinner is on the terrace of The Desire restaurant over-looking the beach. We highly enjoyed this meal and the atmosphere. There is a very limited menu for it, but there's enough variety that you can have a meal that you should be able to enjoy.
reviews.title: Brilliant Honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from the Occidental Grande And I agree a lot with the Post below me. The first impression that I got when I came into the Occidental is that it was not very clean. The lobby bar (which was very small) was swarming in fruit flies and very "sticky" looking. This feel continuted throughout the lobby itself. We were upgraded to conciere level, which I thought was great, but our room was nothing spectacular. I did Not appreciate the mini bar at all. it consisted of 2 bottles of water, 2 baby beers, and a few cokes, which, they only refilled every other day, and I called about 3 times for extra water, and the last person told me to go buy some in the lobby for now!!
reviews.title: just...good

likes.disliked: — Mini bar, Bartenders with no personality

reviews.text: The customer service got better from there....I was told on the first 2 days that the swim up bar didnt have bacardi, then on the third day, i asked a new bartender and he gave it to me.
reviews.title: Not Very Accomidating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to the bar one morning 10 minutes before it would open and I asked the bartender for a glass of water, and he interupted me by saying "WE OPEN AT 10 O'CLOCK!" And then walked away.
reviews.title: Anniversay

likes.disliked: — cigarette and cigar smoke coming from casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I felt that every single bartender had a very poor attitude, except for Ceasar....He was AWESOME and even kept the Swim up bar open alittle later as people were enjoying The Football game.
reviews.title: Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the Occidental was very good. We had the Habachi one night, and It was probally the best I've ever had (he even let me try to cook, as you can see from the photo). The Mexican was ok, But lacked atmosphere, and the Caribbean restaurant was good. We never tried the Italian as we went out to dinner the other nights. (FYI-El Gaucho is FANTASTIC)
reviews.title: Do Not Honeymoon here; especially during Hurricane Season

likes.liked: — The food at the Zen restaurant and the Italian restaurant was good.

description: Located on the legendary island of Aruba, the Occidental Grand Aruba is an all-inclusive luxury hotel on beautiful Palm Beach. The Grand Aruba Resort features a casino, dining, bars, nightlife, water sports and elegant event space for meetings & weddings.
